ANR150.name: Academic Success and Careers in Agriculture and Natural Resources
ANR150.description: Decision making and critical thinking for success in college. Time management, classroom ethics, test taking, listening and writing. University resources and career paths in agriculture and natural resource fields.

ANR192.name: Environmental Issues Seminar
ANR192.description: Environmental issues and problems explored from a variety of perspectives, including legal, scientific, historical, political, socio-economic, and technical points of view.
ANR192.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences or in the College of Engineering or in the College of Natural Science or in the College of Social Science. Approval of college.

ANR210.name: Pathways in Integrated Learning
ANR210.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ANR210.description: Active, self-directed, and reflective learning associated with agriculture and natural resource issues, self and social development, and ethical choice making. Development of a learning plan and design of a learning portfolio. Individual and group presentations.

ANR250.name: Global Issues in Agriculture and Natural Resources
ANR250.description: Globalization. Economic, political, and social issues related to natural resources and agricultural production. Historical perspectives and future projections.
ANR250.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

ANR292.name: Applications in Environmental Studies
ANR292.description: Community engagement project. Projects vary depending on student's major and area of environmental interest.
ANR292.restrictions: Open to students in the Environmental Studies Specialization.

ANR310.name: Integrated Learning Seminar I
ANR310.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ANR310.description: Learner-directed critical analysis of contemporary issues in community systems. Communication of outcomes to professional communities. Collaborative learning integrated with individual experiences.

ANR311.name: Integrated Learning Seminar II
ANR311.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ANR311.description: Advanced analysis and presentation of contemporary issues in community systems

ANR392.name: Agriculture and Natural Resources Seminar
ANR392.description: Current agricultural, natural resources and environmental problems and solutions. Discussion leaders from various disciplines.
ANR392.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

ANR410.name: Integrated Learning Transitions
ANR410.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ANR410.description: Synthesis and analysis of structured experiences in community systems. Personal and interpersonal development, personal and professional integrity, communication competence, and critical and reflective thinking.

ANR475.name: International Studies in Agriculture and Natural Resources
ANR475.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ANR475.description: Study-travel experience. Contemporary problems affecting agriculture and natural resources in world, national and local communities. Case studies and interviews with officials, community leaders and leading professionals.

ANR490.name: Independent Study in Agriculture and Natural Resources
ANR490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ANR490.description: Supervised individual study in topics related to agriculture and natural resources.
ANR490.restrictions: Open to sophomores or juniors or seniors or graduate students in the College of Agriculture and Natural Resources.

ANR491.name: Selected Topics
ANR491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ANR491.description: Special topics in agriculture and natural resources.
ANR491.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

ANR493.name: Professional Internship in Agriculture and Natural Resources
ANR493.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ANR493.description: Supervised professional experiences in agencies and businesses related to a student's major field of study.
ANR493.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Agriculture and Natural Resources. Approval of department; application required. A student may earn a maximum of 6 credits in all enrollments for any or all of these courses

ANR820.name: Proseminar in Food and Agricultural Standards
ANR820.description: Interdisciplinary theoretical and applied perspectives on societal roles and implications of standards in food and agriculture.

ANR891.name: Food and Agricultural Standards Seminar
ANR891.description: Integration of multidisciplinary perspectives on Food and Agricultural Standards.
